content.text: (a) Write down the mathematical name of quadrilateral \(A\).
(b) Find the area of quadrilateral \(A\).
(i) quadrilateral \(B\),
(ii) quadrilateral \(C\).
(c) Describe fully the single transformation that maps quadrilateral \(A\) onto
(i) quadrilateral \(C\) after a \(90^{\circ}\) anticlockwise rotation about the origin,
(ii) quadrilateral \(C\) after a reflection in the line \(x=1\).

1 The diagram shows three quadrilaterals on a \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) grid.
Use set notation to describe the shaded region.
(i) Write down all the square numbers in the universal set, \(\mathcal{E}\).
(ii) Write down the six prime numbers in the universal set, \(\mathcal{E}\).
(iii) \(M=\{x: x \text { is a multiple of } 3\}\) \(F=\{x: x \text { is a factor of } 15\}\)
(b) \(\mathcal{E}=\{x: x \text { is a natural number} \leqslant 16\}\)
(c) Find \(\mathrm{n}(M \cap F)\).
(d) A number is chosen at random from the universal set, \(\mathcal{E}\).
Find the probability that this number is in set \(F\).
(a) The flight for an adult costs \(\$ 630\).
The cost for a child is \(\frac{5}{8}\) of the adult cost.
Show that the total cost of the flight for the family is \(\$ 2441\), correct to the nearest dollar.
(i) Work out how long the plane is flying, in hours and minutes.
h min
(ii) Write your answer to part (b)(i) in hours, correct to 3 decimal places.
(iii) The flight distance from Shanghai to Sydney is 7882 km . The flight distance from Sydney to Auckland is 2156 km .
Find the total distance the plane flies.
(iv) Calculate the average speed of the plane when it is flying.
(b) The plane leaves Shanghai at 2005 local time on 13th November.
The plane stops for 2 hours 30 minutes in Sydney.
The plane lands in Auckland at 1725 local time on 14th November.
The local time in Auckland is 5 hours ahead of the local time in Shanghai.
(c) The holiday expenses are in the ratio
hotel : car hire : food \(=8:5:6\).
The cost of the hotel is \(\$ 2400\).
Show that the total of the holiday expenses is \(\$ 5700\).
3 Mr Zhang, his wife and three children go on a holiday from Shanghai to Auckland.
(a) (i) Write down the mathematical name of this polygon.
(ii) Show that the interior angle of this polygon is \(135^{\circ}\).

Find the value of \(k\).

5 (a) Work out the number of days in seven weeks.
(b) The summit of Mount Everest is 8848 metres above sea level. Lying Lake is 154 metres below sea level.
Work out the difference in height between these places.
(c) Find two integers that have a sum of -12 and a product of 32 .
(i) a decimal,
(ii) a percentage.

(h) The height, \(h\) metres, of a fence post is 2.43 m , correct to the nearest centimetre.
Complete the statement about the value of \(h\).

content.text: Write down two comments comparing the results from 7 pm with the results from 1 pm .
(i) Complete the table.
(ii) Complete the pie chart.
(c) 270 meals are ordered one day at the restaurant. The table shows the number of each type of meal.
6 Maria owns a restaurant with 30 tables.
One day she records the number of customers at each table at 7 pm .
The bar chart shows the results.

(ii) Write down the equation of the line of symmetry that does not intersect the graph.

(b) On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=\frac{15}{x}\) for \(-15 \leqslant x \leqslant-1\) and \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 15\).

In the diagram, \(D, E\) and \(F\) are points on a circle, centre \(O\). \(A B\) is a tangent to the circle at \(E\). Lines \(A B\) and \(C D\) are parallel and angle \(B E D=68^{\circ}\).
\(P Q Q\) is a sector of a circle, centre \(O\) and radius 7.5 cm .
The sector angle is \(60^{\circ}\).
Calculate the length of the arc \(P Q\).
(a) (i) Each year he earns \(\$ 6000\) plus \(3 \%\) of the year's profit.
Calculate the amount he earns in a year when the profit is \(\$ 320600\).
(ii) In the following year the profit is \(\$ 347851\).
Calculate the percentage increase in the profit.
(b) Ahmed employs three people, Budi, Citra and Dian. Budi earns \(\$ 17000\), Citra earns \(\$ 13600\) and Dian earns \(\$ 6800\).
Find the ratio of their earnings in its simplest form.
Budi : Citra : Dian =
(c) Ahmed buys materials from China costing 7560 yuan.
Work out the cost of the materials in dollars when the exchange rate is \(\$ 1=7.06\) yuan. Give your answer correct to the nearest dollar.
(d) Ahmed borrows \(\$ 8000\) for 3 years at a rate of \(5 \%\) per year compound interest.
Calculate the amount of interest he will pay at the end of the 3 years.
9 Ahmed owns a company.
